CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 3, 1962, pg. 2, reads: "Cream Of The Crop - Representative of some of the best Pittsburgh has to offer the future are these six youngsters, shown with two of their mentors, who were named winners of $500 scholarship awards at The COurier's recent Appreciation Day Rally at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall. Top photo, are Erroll Davis Jr., a freshman at Carnegie Institute of Technology, majoring in physics; Mrs. Mildred Jones of Duquesne, who accepted an award for her daughter, Marva P. Jones (shown in photo at right), who is preparing for a career in civil rights field, as a first- year student in the Howard University School of Law, and Wilbert E. Rolle, a freshman in the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Erroll Davis Jr., Mildred Jones, proxy for daughter Marva, and Wilbert E. Rolle, holding scholarship award received during Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper's Appreciation Rally Day at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall
